he's removing the H on he when he says

isn't when he says isn't he this example
combines two important native
pronunciation rules one the reduction of
the H on pronouns and two reduction of
the T in n T words first through duck
of the h'm pronouns happens when the
pronoun starts with an H like he him/her
his etc for example is he becomes easy
then he becomes then e but her becomes
butter why his becomes why is next the
reduction of the T happens in nt words
followed by a vowel sound
for example Internet becomes internet
international becomes international went
out becomes when out and in all NT
contractions for example isn't it
becomes isn't it aren't I becomes aren't
I but in this scene there are a few

combined is he or isn't he he's any
